bestBHT.bht: In order to imitate us and live in a manner that reflects our behavior, you should follow our example. Paul understood the importance of setting a model for the new Christians to emulate. He made it clear that he and his fellow workers did not live disorderly lives among them but walked in holiness, justice, and blamelessness. Their actions were a testimony to the Thessalonians, showing them how to live purposeful and dedicated lives.

Henry Alford: 7.] how ye ought to imitate us is a concise way of expressing ‘how ye ought to walk in imitation of us,’
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: 7. how ye ought to follow us—how
ye ought to live so as to "imitate (so the Greek
Albert Barnes: You know what you should do in order to imitate us.
For we behaved not ourselves disorderly among you.
Marvin Vincent: Follow [μιμεισθαι] . Better, imitate. Comp. 1 Corinthians 4:16; 1 Corinthians 11:1; Philippians 3:17; 1 Thessalonians 1:6.
Philip Schaff: 2 Thessalonians 3:7. On this and the following verse, see notes on the First Epistle, chap. 2.
Archibald T. Robertson: How it is necessary to imitate us.
Paul knew that he had to set the new Christians in the midst of Jews and Gentiles a model for their imitation.
Specific denial on Paul's part in contrast to verse 2 Thessalonians 3:6; 2 Thessalonians 3:17.
John Gill: They ought to walk as they had the apostles for ensamples; for who should they follow but their spiritual fathers, shepherds, and guides?
They could appeal to them as witnesses, and God also, how holily, justly, and unblamably they walked among them.
They did not live an idle and inactive life among them.

bhtAttempts.bht: You should imitate us and follow our example, living in a way that reflects our behavior, just as we imitate Christ. Paul knew that it was necessary for him to set an example for the new Christians, especially since they were surrounded by different cultures and influences. He made it clear that he and his fellow workers had not lived in a disorderly manner among them but had walked in holiness, justice, and blamelessness. They didn't live lives of idleness or inactivity, but were diligent in their work and example.

In order to imitate us and follow our example, you should walk in a manner that reflects our behavior. Paul knew that it was necessary to set a model for the new Christians to emulate, especially in the midst of diverse cultures and influences. He emphasized that he and his fellow workers did not live disorderly lives among them. Instead, they walked in holiness, justice, and blamelessness. They were diligent and active in their work, serving as a witness to the Thessalonians.

To imitate us and follow our example, you must walk in our footsteps. Paul understood the importance of setting a pattern for the new believers to follow, especially in the midst of cultural diversity. He emphasized that he and his fellow workers did not live in a disorderly manner among them, but instead, they walked in righteousness and integrity. Their actions served as a model for the Thessalonians, demonstrating how to live purposeful and dedicated lives.

To walk in imitation of us is the path you should tread. Paul desired the new believers to follow their example, knowing that they had to set a model for their imitation amidst diverse influences. They emphasized that they did not live in a disorderly manner but walked in righteousness, justice, and blamelessness among the Thessalonians. Their actions spoke volumes about how they should live in devotion and dedication.

In order to imitate us and live in a manner that reflects our behavior, you should follow our example. Paul understood the importance of setting a model for the new Christians to emulate. He made it clear that he and his fellow workers did not live disorderly lives among them but walked in holiness, justice, and blamelessness. Their actions were a testimony to the Thessalonians, showing them how to live purposeful and dedicated lives.
